title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0001
text: Which package contains the NavigableMap interface?
explanation: The NavigableMap interface is part of the java.util package.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0002
text: Which interface does NavigableMap extend?
explanation: The NavigableMap interface extends the SortedMap interface.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0003
text: What is the main characteristic of a NavigableMap?

options.text: It provides navigation methods for closest key matches

explanation: NavigableMap provides navigation methods to find closest matches for keys.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0004
text: Which of the following classes implements the NavigableMap interface?
explanation: TreeMap is the main implementation of the NavigableMap interface.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0005
text: Which of the following methods returns the greatest key less than the given key?
explanation: The lowerKey(K key) method returns the greatest key strictly less than the given key.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0006
text: Which of the following methods returns the greatest key less than or equal to the given key?
explanation: The floorKey(K key) method returns the greatest key less than or equal to the given key.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0007
text: Which of the following methods returns the least key greater than or equal to the given key?
explanation: The ceilingKey(K key) method returns the least key greater than or equal to the given key.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0008
text: Which of the following methods returns the least key strictly greater than the given key?
explanation: The higherKey(K key) method returns the least key strictly greater than the given key.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0009
text: Which of the following methods retrieves and removes the first entry of the map?
explanation: The pollFirstEntry() method retrieves and removes the first entry of the map, or returns null if empty.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0010
text: Which of the following methods retrieves and removes the last entry of the map?
explanation: The pollLastEntry() method retrieves and removes the last entry of the map, or returns null if empty.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0011
text: Which of the following methods returns a reverse order view of the map?
explanation: The descendingMap() method returns a reverse order view of the map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0012
text: Which of the following methods returns a NavigableSet view of the keys in reverse order?
explanation: The descendingKeySet() method returns a NavigableSet view of the keys in reverse order.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0013
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and duplicates?

options.text: NavigableMap does not allow duplicate keys

explanation: NavigableMap does not allow duplicate keys, but values can be duplicated.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0014
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and null keys?

options.text: TreeMap does not allow null keys

explanation: TreeMap does not allow null keys because it uses natural ordering or a comparator.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0015
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and ordering?

options.text: NavigableMap maintains keys in ascending order by default

explanation: NavigableMap maintains keys in ascending order by default.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0016
text: Which of the following methods returns a view of the portion of the map less than a given key?
explanation: The headMap(K toKey, boolean inclusive) method returns a view of the portion of the map less than the given key.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0017
text: Which of the following methods returns a view of the portion of the map greater than a given key?
explanation: The tailMap(K fromKey, boolean inclusive) method returns a view of the portion of the map greater than the given key.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0018
text: Which of the following methods returns a view of the portion of the map between two keys?

options.text: subMap(K fromKey, boolean fromInclusive, K toKey, boolean toInclusive)

explanation: The subMap(K fromKey, boolean fromInclusive, K toKey, boolean toInclusive) method returns a view of the portion of the map between two keys.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0019
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and comparator?

options.text: A custom Comparator can define the sorting order
Comparator cannot be used with NavigableMap
Comparator is used only for duplicates

explanation: A custom Comparator can be provided to define the sorting order of keys in a NavigableMap.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0020
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and natural ordering?

options.text: If no comparator is provided, natural ordering is used
Natural ordering is used only for duplicates

explanation: If no comparator is provided, NavigableMap uses the natural ordering of its keys.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0021
text: Which of the following methods returns the first entry in the map?
explanation: The firstEntry() method returns the first (lowest) key-value mapping in the map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0022
text: Which of the following methods returns the last entry in the map?
explanation: The lastEntry() method returns the last (highest) key-value mapping in the map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0023
text: Which of the following methods returns the entry with the greatest key less than the given key?
explanation: The lowerEntry(K key) method returns the entry with the greatest key strictly less than the given key.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0024
text: Which of the following methods returns the entry with the greatest key less than or equal to the given key?
explanation: The floorEntry(K key) method returns the entry with the greatest key less than or equal to the given key.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0025
text: Which of the following methods returns the entry with the least key greater than or equal to the given key?
explanation: The ceilingEntry(K key) method returns the entry with the least key greater than or equal to the given key.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0026
text: Which of the following methods returns the entry with the least key strictly greater than the given key?
explanation: The higherEntry(K key) method returns the entry with the least key strictly greater than the given key.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0027
text: Which of the following methods removes and returns the first entry?
explanation: The pollFirstEntry() method removes and returns the first entry in the map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0028
text: Which of the following methods removes and returns the last entry?
explanation: The pollLastEntry() method removes and returns the last entry in the map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0029
text: Which of the following methods returns a reverse order view of the map?
explanation: The descendingMap() method returns a reverse order view of the map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0030
text: Which of the following methods returns a NavigableSet view of the keys in reverse order?
explanation: The descendingKeySet() method returns a NavigableSet view of the keys in reverse order.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0031
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and TreeMap?
explanation: TreeMap implements the NavigableMap interface.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0032
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and synchronization?

options.text: NavigableMap is not synchronized by default

explanation: NavigableMap is not synchronized by default; synchronization can be achieved using Collections.synchronizedNavigableMap().

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0033
text: Which of the following methods can be used to synchronize a NavigableMap?
explanation: The Collections.synchronizedNavigableMap() method returns a synchronized (thread-safe) navigable map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0034
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and fail-fast behavior?

options.text: Iterators of most NavigableMap implementations are fail-fast

explanation: Iterators of most NavigableMap implementations are fail-fast and throw ConcurrentModificationException if modified during iteration.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0035
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and comparator()?

options.text: comparator() returns null if natural ordering is used
comparator() throws exception if no comparator

explanation: If natural ordering is used, comparator() returns null.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0036
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and null keys?

options.text: TreeMap does not allow null keys

explanation: TreeMap does not allow null keys because it uses natural ordering or a comparator.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0037
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and null values?

options.text: TreeMap does not allow null values
TreeMap allows only one null value

explanation: TreeMap allows null values but not null keys.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0038
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and descendingMap()?

options.text: descendingMap() returns a reverse order view of the map

explanation: The descendingMap() method returns a reverse order view of the map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0039
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and comparator chaining?

options.text: Comparator chaining allows multiple comparison criteria
Comparator chaining is used for synchronization

explanation: Comparator chaining allows multiple comparison criteria using methods like thenComparing().

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0040
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and TreeMap performance?

options.text: TreeMap provides O(log n) performance for basic operations

explanation: TreeMap provides O(log n) performance for add, remove, and containsKey operations.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0041
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and keySet()?

options.text: keySet() returns a NavigableSet view of keys
keySet() returns a List view of keys
keySet() returns a Collection of values
keySet() returns a Map of keys

explanation: The keySet() method returns a NavigableSet view of the keys contained in the map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0042
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and entrySet()?

options.text: entrySet() returns a Set view of key-value pairs
entrySet() returns a List view of keys
entrySet() returns a Collection of values
entrySet() returns a Map of entries

explanation: The entrySet() method returns a Set view of the key-value pairs contained in the map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0043
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and values()?

options.text: values() returns a Collection view of values
values() returns a Set view of values
values() returns a Map of values
values() returns a List of keys

explanation: The values() method returns a Collection view of the values contained in the map.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0044
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and immutability?

options.text: NavigableMap can be made unmodifiable using Collections.unmodifiableNavigableMap()

explanation: NavigableMap can be made unmodifiable using the Collections.unmodifiableNavigableMap() method.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0045
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and fail-fast iterators?
explanation: Fail-fast iterators throw ConcurrentModificationException if the map is modified during iteration.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0046
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and comparator chaining?

options.text: Comparator chaining allows multiple comparison criteria
Comparator chaining is used for synchronization

explanation: Comparator chaining allows multiple comparison criteria using methods like thenComparing().

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0047
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and TreeMap synchronization?

options.text: TreeMap is not synchronized by default

explanation: TreeMap is not synchronized by default; synchronization can be achieved using Collections.synchronizedNavigableMap().

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0048
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and comparator() return value?

options.text: Returns null if natural ordering is used

explanation: If natural ordering is used, comparator() returns null.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0049
text: Which of the following is true about NavigableMap and iteration order?

options.text: Iteration follows ascending key order by default

explanation: Iteration over a NavigableMap follows ascending key order by default.

title: JavaCollectionsFrameworkNavigableMap - Q0050
text: Which of the following best describes the NavigableMap interface?

options.text: A map that maintains keys in sorted order and provides navigation methods
A map that maintains insertion order
A map that allows duplicate keys
A map that stores keys randomly

explanation: The NavigableMap interface represents a map that maintains keys in sorted order and provides navigation methods.
